verification_task.name: configuration-vsftpd-security_baseline
verification_task.description: The vsftpd.conf configuration complies with security baselines: 1) Anonymous access is disabled (anonymous_enable=NO) 2) allow_writeable_chroot is not configured (default NO), automatically triggering protection mechanism against chroot escape when chroot_local_user=YES and write_enable=YES 3) File transfer logs use the default secure path (/var/log/vsftpd.log). The main risk point is write_enable=YES allowing authenticated users to modify files, relying on system user permission controls.

verification_task.name: binary-busybox-stripped-symbols-high-risk
verification_task.description: Analysis of 'bin/busybox' is hindered by symbol stripping (stripped ELF). Specific manifestations: 1) Inability to locate the telnetd_main function's network input processing logic 2) Failure to trace the command-line parameter handling flow of ash 3) Verification failure of critical data flow paths. Trigger condition: firmware compilation using strip command to remove symbol tables. Security impact: Unable to confirm existence of buffer overflow or command injection vulnerabilities, but presence of high-risk applets (telnetd/sh) indicates potential attack surface if services remain enabled.
